extendedIngredients.name: prosciutto
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pound lean prosciutto in 1 piece, plus 4 thin slices, cut into ribbons
extendedIngredients.originalName: lean prosciutto in 1 piece, plus 4 thin slices, cut into ribbons

title: Prosciutto Consommé with Arugula and Melon
summary: Need a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal main course? Prosciutto Consommé with Arugulan and Melon could be an amazing recipe to try. This recipe serves 4 and costs $5.05 per serving. One portion of this dish contains roughly 35g of protein, 63g of fat, and a total of 765 calories. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. If you have egg whites, cantaloupe, carrot, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the cantaloupe you could follow this main course with the Cantaloupe Sherbet as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 55%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Arugula Salad with Melon and Prosciutto, Grilled Pizza With Prosciutto, Melon, Arugula, And Creme Fraiche, and Prosciutto Consomme With Shrimp And Bacon-poached Eggs.
instructions: Using a sharp knife, remove the skin from the prosciutto and cut it into 1-inch pieces. Cut the prosciutto meat and fat into 1-inch pieces and coarsely grind in a meat grinder or coarsely chop in a food processor, pulsing several times.                                              Transfer the ground prosciutto and the pieces of skin to a large soup pot. Add the carrot, onion, garlic, fennel seeds and rosemary and cook over moderate heat, stirring, until the fat is rendered, about 10 minutes. Add the cold water and bring to a boil. Simmer over moderately low heat until the broth is flavorful and reduced to 10 cups, about 1 1/2 hours. Strain the broth into a clean soup pot and refrigerate until chilled. Discard the solids.                                              Skim the fat from the broth and discard. In a medium bowl, knead the ground pork with the egg whites and lemon juice and stir it into the cold prosciutto broth. Slowly bring the broth to a simmer, stirring constantly until the pork mixture rises completely to the top. Stir gently to dislodge any pork from the bottom of the pot. Simmer over moderately low heat, undisturbed, for 15 minutes. Using a skimmer or a slotted spoon, gently remove the "raft" from the broth and discard.                                              Line a sieve with cheesecloth. Strain the consomm into a saucepan. Skim off any remaining fat from the surface. Season the consomm with salt and keep warm.                                              Place the melon balls and prosciutto ribbons in 4 shallow soup bowls and top with the arugula. Ladle 1 cup of the warm consomm into each bowl and serve.

steps.step: Using a sharp knife, remove the skin from the prosciutto and cut it into 1-inch pieces.
Cut the prosciutto meat and fat into 1-inch pieces and coarsely grind in a meat grinder or coarsely chop in a food processor, pulsing several times.
Transfer the ground prosciutto and the pieces of skin to a large soup pot.
Add the carrot, onion, garlic, fennel seeds and rosemary and cook over moderate heat, stirring, until the fat is rendered, about 10 minutes.

Add the cold water and bring to a boil. Simmer over moderately low heat until the broth is flavorful and reduced to 10 cups, about 1 1/2 hours. Strain the broth into a clean soup pot and refrigerate until chilled. Discard the solids.

Skim the fat from the broth and discard. In a medium bowl, knead the ground pork with the egg whites and lemon juice and stir it into the cold prosciutto broth. Slowly bring the broth to a simmer, stirring constantly until the pork mixture rises completely to the top. Stir gently to dislodge any pork from the bottom of the pot. Simmer over moderately low heat, undisturbed, for 15 minutes. Using a skimmer or a slotted spoon, gently remove the "raft" from the broth and discard.
Line a sieve with cheesecloth. Strain the consomm into a saucepan. Skim off any remaining fat from the surface. Season the consomm with salt and keep warm.
Place the melon balls and prosciutto ribbons in 4 shallow soup bowls and top with the arugula. Ladle 1 cup of the warm consomm into each bowl and serve.
